headline: Associate Legal Advisor at U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE)
summary:
Government information law attorney with 9 years of legal and litigation experience.

Specialties: Information Law, Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), Privacy, Litigation, National Security Law, Criminal Law, International Law, Intelligence, Legal Research, International Human Rights Law, International Relations, Law of Armed Conflict, Document Review, Westlaw, Lexis.

defaultPosition.description:
â¢ Responsible for providing legal advice on all matters relating to the disclosure of agency information both within and outside the U.S. Department of Homeland Security.
â¢ Handle a vast array of privacy and disclosure-related issues, including: federal, state, and foreign requests for information; and reviews of national and international information sharing agreements.
â¢ Efficiently produce quality legal analyses of complex issues within the area of FOIA, Privacy, and information disclosure law.
â¢ Handle third party requests and subpoenas for agency testimony, as well as documents which entail corresponding with parties and subpoenaed employees.
â¢ Work closely with the ICE Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Office and the U.S. Department of Justice in coordinating the agency's response to FOIA litigation.
â¢ Review requested documents, redact documents to preserve privileges, and prepare declarations in support of privileges asserted.
defaultPosition.title: Associate Legal Advisor

positions.description:
â¢ Responsible for providing legal advice on all matters relating to the disclosure of agency information both within and outside the U.S. Department of Homeland Security.
â¢ Handle a vast array of privacy and disclosure-related issues, including: federal, state, and foreign requests for information; and reviews of national and international information sharing agreements.

positions.title: Associate Legal Advisor

positions.description:
â¢	Provided legal and policy advice to OGC leadership and the Department of Justice regarding eighteen (18) assigned Guantanamo Bay detainee habeas cases. 
â¢	Drafted, edited, and revised factual returns, motions, briefs, memoranda, and declarations for filing in U.S. District Court.
â¢	Maintained security of sensitive and classified information, and coordinated clearance for the use of such documents in U.S. District Court.
â¢	Analyzed all court orders, specifically case management and discovery orders, pertaining to detainee habeas litigation to ensure case compliance. 
â¢	Coordinated all interdepartmental case issues of detainee habeas litigation, with DOJ, Civil Division, Federal Programs and DOD OGC.  Worked closely and diplomatically with other agencies, including state, federal, and other law enforcement partners.
â¢	Handled FOIA requests submitted to DOD OGC by providing legal advice regarding the requests and responses.
â¢	Worked with a team of attorneys and support staff on a sensitive, very large, multi-year, and multi-agency FOIA project involving âDonât Ask Donât Tell.â  Also handled highly sensitive FOIA requests involving Senior Army Officer Leadership.
positions.title: Associate Deputy General Counsel

positions.description:
â¢ Worked for several law firms including Wilson Sonsini, Sidney Austin, Hogan and Hartson, Vinson and Elkins, and Proskauer Rose. 
â¢ Gained experience with large volume document review. 
â¢ Worked individually and on teams searching for issues and patterns based on relevance and privilege within documents.
positions.title: Contract Attorney

positions.companyName: Kansas Board of Indigent's Defense Services
positions.description:
â¢ Worked as a Public Defender with an average case load of 30 felony cases. 
â¢ Types of crimes defended included Aggravated Burglary, Aggravated Battery, Aggravated Assault, DUI, Theft, Forgery, Flee & Elude, Manufacturing of Methamphetamine, Distribution of Methamphetamine, Possession of Marijuana, and Possession of Paraphernalia. 
â¢ Worked on all case phases, including first appearance, plea negotiations, preliminary hearing, arraignment, trial, sentencing, and post-sentencing.
positions.title: Public Defender

positions.description:
â¢ Worked as an associate attorney for Mr. Robertson. 
â¢ In this capacity, my work was mainly legal research and memo writing on complex legal issues, including municipal, property, contracts, and constitutional law questions.
positions.title: Associate Attorney

positions.description:
â¢ Pursuant to a Student Practice Order, provided direct legal representation for indigent clients who were accused of misdemeanors in Nassau County and New York City. 
â¢ As the sole summer advocate for clinic, was responsible for Criminal Justice Clinic's entire case load. 
â¢ Appeared on the record in Nassau District Court and Queens Criminal Court more than 15 times while in law school.
positions.title: Clinic Advocate
